candidates.definition: Electrical devices designed for individual use in homes for personal care, fitness, or household tasks

positive_examples: She plugged in her hair dryer to style her hair before the party
The kitchen blender makes perfect smoothies every morning
I run on my electric treadmill for thirty minutes daily
The tumble dryer finished the laundry cycle with a beep
He charged his electric toothbrush on the bathroom counter
The electric cooktop heated up quickly for dinner preparation
negative_examples: The factory assembly line uses industrial mixing equipment
The hospital's medical imaging machine requires specialized training
The office printer connects to the company network
The television broadcast reaches millions of viewers
The car's electronic engine management system optimized fuel efficiency
The building's electrical wiring powers the entire structure
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: IndustrialElectronics, MedicalElectronics, CommunicationDevices, ComputerHardware

candidates.definition: Electronic tools and equipment used in manufacturing, assembly, and industrial production processes

positive_examples: The technician heated up the soldering iron to repair the circuit board.
Industrial oscilloscopes monitor signal quality in the production line.
The factory uses specialized electronic welding equipment for assembly.
Automated testing equipment checks each component before packaging.
The manufacturing plant installed new electronic monitoring systems.
Professional-grade multimeters are essential for industrial diagnostics.
negative_examples: She listened to music on her smartphone headphones.
The home theater system has excellent surround sound.
His gaming laptop runs the latest video games smoothly.
The smart thermostat adjusts temperature automatically.
The fitness tracker monitors her daily steps and heart rate.
The digital camera captured stunning landscape photos.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: ConsumerElectronics, MedicalElectronics, AutomotiveElectronics, MilitaryElectronics

candidates.definition: Physical electrical elements that perform specific functions within electronic circuits and systems.

positive_examples: The capacitor stores electrical energy in the power supply circuit.
Replace the faulty inductor coil in the radio frequency filter.
The solenoid valve controls fluid flow when energized.
Check all resistors and transistors on the circuit board.
The transfer switch automatically connects to backup power.
Measure the voltage across each component in the amplifier circuit.
negative_examples: The oscilloscope displays the circuit's waveform patterns.
Program the microcontroller to handle sensor inputs.
The circuit board substrate provides mechanical support.
Install the latest firmware update on the device.
The power adapter converts AC to DC voltage.
Use proper ESD protection when handling electronics.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: TestInstruments, ElectronicDevices, PowerSystems, SignalProcessing

candidates.definition: Electronic devices designed to transmit, receive, or process information signals for communication purposes.

positive_examples: The pilot adjusted the radio frequency on his communication device.
She plugged her phone into the telephone jack on the wall.
The Wi-Fi access point provided internet connectivity throughout the office.
The radar system detected incoming aircraft from fifty miles away.
The old telegraph machine tapped out messages in Morse code.
The radio receiver picked up the emergency broadcast signal.
negative_examples: The computer processor executed calculations at high speed.
The LED light bulb illuminated the entire room brightly.
The electric motor powered the conveyor belt smoothly.
The battery charger restored power to the dead phone.
The security camera recorded footage of the parking lot.
The microwave oven heated the leftovers in two minutes.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: ComputingDevice, PowerElectronics, SensorElectronics, DisplayElectronics, AudioElectronics

candidates.definition: Electronic devices that capture, convert, display, or transmit audio and video signals.

positive_examples: The security camera recorded everything that happened in the parking lot.
She spoke clearly into the microphone during her presentation.
The television display showed crisp, high-definition images.
The sound engineer adjusted the audio transducer to eliminate feedback.
We need to install speakers and monitors for the conference room.
The camcorder captured both video and audio of the wedding ceremony.
negative_examples: The smartphone's processor handles all computational tasks efficiently.
The LED light bulb consumes much less energy than incandescent bulbs.
The electric motor spun the fan blades at high speed.
The circuit board contained dozens of resistors and capacitors.
The power supply converted AC current to DC for the computer.
The wireless router transmitted data packets across the network.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: ComputingDevices, PowerElectronics, CommunicationEquipment, ElectronicComponents

candidates.definition: Electronic devices designed for processing, storing, or manipulating digital information and data.

positive_examples: She typed her report on the computer keyboard in the office.
The external hard drive stores all my family photos and documents.
The copy machine in the library can scan and print multiple pages quickly.
His USB flash drive contains the presentation files for tomorrow's meeting.
The office photocopier jammed while making copies of the contract.
The wireless keyboard connects to my tablet via Bluetooth.
negative_examples: The television displayed the evening news broadcast clearly.
She adjusted the volume on her radio to hear the music better.
The microwave heated up the leftover pizza in two minutes.
His smartphone battery died during the important phone call.
The air conditioner kept the room cool during the hot summer day.
The LED light bulb illuminated the entire kitchen brightly.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: AudioVisualElectronics, CommunicationDevices, HomeAppliances, LightingElectronics

candidates.definition: Electronic devices that manage, regulate, or interface with electrical power and device operation

positive_examples: The thermostat controller automatically adjusts the heating system temperature
She plugged the laptop charger into the wall outlet
The power adapter allows European plugs to work in American outlets
The game controller responded perfectly to every button press
I need to find an outlet adapter for my phone charger when traveling
The industrial controller monitors all factory equipment status
negative_examples: The LED light bulb illuminated the entire room brightly
The smartphone's touchscreen displayed vivid colors and sharp text
The microwave heated the food using electromagnetic radiation
The transistor amplified the electrical signal in the circuit
The battery stored electrical energy for later use
The speaker produced clear audio from the amplified signal
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: DisplayDevices, AudioElectronics, PowerSupply, ProcessingComponents

candidates.definition: Electronic devices that generate, control, or emit light for various purposes including illumination, signaling, or decoration.

positive_examples: The Christmas lights flickered cheerfully around the window frame.
She activated the laser pointer to highlight key points on her presentation slide.
The doorbell flashing light alerted the deaf resident that someone was at the door.
LED strips under the kitchen cabinets provided ambient lighting for cooking.
The disco ball's rotating lights created colorful patterns across the dance floor.
He adjusted the smart bulb's brightness using his smartphone app.
negative_examples: The mechanic used an electric drill to tighten the screws.
She charged her smartphone using the wall outlet.
The refrigerator's compressor hummed quietly in the kitchen.
He turned up the volume on his wireless speakers.
The laptop's cooling fan spun faster during intensive processing.
The security camera recorded footage throughout the night.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: AudioElectronics, ComputingDevices, CommunicationElectronics, PowerElectronics
